value.message: Uses error log level for exporter initialization failure, which may not be a critical system failure.
value.suggestion: Use warn or info log level unless the failure is critical and requires immediate attention.

value.message: Uses error log level for OTLP export failure, which may not always be a critical issue.
value.suggestion: Use warn log level for recoverable export failures; reserve error for critical failures.

value.message: Uses error log level for OTLP batch export failure, which may not always be a critical issue.
value.suggestion: Use warn log level for recoverable batch export failures; reserve error for critical failures.

value.message: Uses error log level for shutdown errors, which may not always be critical.
value.suggestion: Use warn log level for shutdown errors unless they are critical.

value.message: Error is logged without context information such as input parameters or config details.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context (e.g., config, endpoint) in the error log for better debugging.

value.message: Error is logged without context information such as data or exporter name.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context (e.g., data, exporter name) in the error log for better debugging.

value.message: Error is logged without context information such as batch size or signal type.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context (e.g., batch size, signal type) in the error log for better debugging.

value.message: Error is logged without context information such as exporter type or shutdown state.
value.suggestion: Include relevant context (e.g., exporter type, shutdown state) in the error log for better debugging.

value.message: Access control error in exportTraces: if exporter fails, error is thrown but no explicit deny-by-default logic is present. May allow fallback or incomplete denial.
value.suggestion: Ensure that on any error or exception in access control or export logic, access is denied and no fallback to allow state occurs. Return a denied result explicitly.

value.message: Access control error in exportMetrics: if exporter fails, error is thrown but no explicit deny-by-default logic is present. May allow fallback or incomplete denial.
value.suggestion: Ensure that on any error or exception in access control or export logic, access is denied and no fallback to allow state occurs. Return a denied result explicitly.
